name: Jason Zintak
title: CEO at 6sense
about:
As CEO of 6sense, Jason Zintak leads the company‚Äôs mission to help customers revolutionize revenue creation. Leveraging AI and data-driven intelligence, 6sense answers profound questions every B2B sales and marketing teams face like, which accounts are most likely to buy, who should we reach out to, and what should we say to engage?   

Since Jason joined 6sense in 2017, the company has grown significantly by every measure, including increasing revenue from $5MM to $200MM+ ARR. Under Jason‚Äôs leadership, 6sense has been recognized for market-defining technology by Forbes Cloud 100, Inc. 5000, Deloitte Fast 500, Forbes AI50, Financial Times, Gartner, Forrester, and customer review platforms G2 and TrustRadius. The company has received recognition for its strong culture by Fortune and Inc. Magazine. Jason has also been honored by Goldman Sachs as one of the Most Exceptional Entrepreneurs of 2023.  

These accolades result from Jason's focus on making smart moves, prioritizing people, and creating a culture of innovation where every employee is inspired to challenge the status quo and create a better future.  

Jason is a proven leader with a winning record of excellence in scaling marketing and sales organizations in growth-stage B2B software companies. Over the past 23 years, Jason has helped establish disruptive platforms in marketing technology, ERP, CRM, and supply chain. Most recently, he was CEO of Platfora, a leader in big data analytics, which was acquired by Workday in 2016. Prior to that, he was CRO at Responsys, which was acquired by Oracle in 2013 for $1.5B, and EVP of worldwide sales and marketing for JDA Software (now Blue Yonder). He also spent eight years at SAP, where he served in various sales and leadership roles spanning multiple technology categories and industry verticals.  

When asked, Jason will tell you that he's most proud of co-founding an incredible family alongside is wife.

name: Christopher O'Malley
title: President and CEO at Exabeam
location: Hot Springs, South Dakota, United States
about:
With relentless determination fueled by a fiery passion, unwavering courage, and unrelenting perseverance, I am dedicated to providing exceptional service that exceeds the expectations of even the most discerning customers. This commitment to excellence is my unwavering professional true north.

In my wide-ranging career, I have honed my executive leadership skills and provided guidance to numerous boards of directors across a diverse range of IT industry segments. From startups to multinational corporations, from turnarounds to growth-stage companies, and from buying to selling companies, I have consistently delivered extraordinary results and propelled organizations to new heights of success. My track record includes serving as the President and CEO of LogRhythm (Recognized as ‚ÄúColorado Company of the Year‚Äù by the Colorado Technology Association Foundation.), President and CEO of Compuware, President and CEO of VelociData, CEO of Nimsoft, EVP/GM of CA Technologies' Cloud Products & Solutions Business Unit & IT Management SaaS solutions, and EVP/GM of CA Technologies' Mainframe Business.

I graduated with honors from the University of Minnesota with a bachelor of science degree in Computer Science. Additionally, I have completed executive programs at the University of Chicago's Graduate School of Business and New York University's Stern School of Business.

I'm the founder and board member of the O'Malley Foundation. Founded in 1998, the O'Malley Foundation is a charitable organization that grants an annual college scholarship to a deserving student from my high school, Mound-Westonka High School, in Mound, Minnesota. The foundation also supports various youth arts programs and Catholic charities. The O'Malley Foundation has granted nearly 30 college scholarships to deserving students.

I've been interviewed on national radio and on video podcasts on IT transformational leadership. I've been a featured contributor to articles and columns for technology, business, and government-focused publications. In 2017, Crain's Detroit Business honored me as one of the top 50 names to know in IT; IT Services Report named me as one of the Top 25 Government IT Executives in 2020; and Sigma Chi Fraternity honored me as a Significant Sigma Chi.

name: Matthew Granade
title: Building businesses
about:
Matthew Granade is an operating executive, investor, and business builder working at the intersection of artificial intelligence (A.I.), finance, data, and technology.
 
Matthew co-founded Domino Data Lab, a software platform used by businesses and government agencies to build and operate A.I. models.  It is used by more than 30% of the Fortune 100, including Johnson & Johnson, UBS, and Lockheed Martin. Matthew has worked in a variety of operating roles at Domino across sales, marketing, product, finance, and strategy and serves on the company‚Äôs board of directors. The company is backed by Sequoia Capital, among others. 
 
From 2015 through 2020, Matthew ran multiple businesses at Point72, a ~$20 billion global asset manager, including many of the firm‚Äôs data science and innovation initiatives. He managed ~200 professionals across offices in the U.S., Asia, and Europe. He built the firm‚Äôs Market Intelligence unit, which uses a variety of information sources, including so-called alternative data, to provide insights to portfolio managers on the stocks they trade. He also directed the firm‚Äôs central portfolio, which collects stock ideas from a broad array of sources, including portfolio managers and analysts, and algorithmically monetizes them.
 
Additionally, Matthew started and built Point72 Ventures, the firm‚Äôs venture capital unit, which funds early-stage companies in fintech, A.I., cyber-security, and health tech. During his tenure, the firm invested in ~60 companies and deployed ~$500 million in capital.
 
Earlier, Matthew was Co-Head of Research at Bridgewater Associates, a systematic macro hedge fund, where he built and led teams that developed insights on the global economy, created new algorithmic systems for capturing alpha, and published Bridgewater‚Äôs market commentary, Daily Observations.
 
Matthew previously served on the boards of directors of Say Technologies (sold to Robinhood Markets) and Imperative Execution (a top five Alternative Trading System) and as an advisor to Mirador (sold to Cuna Mutual), among others.

Matthew has written in The Wall Street Journal, appeared on CNBC and Bloomberg, been interviewed for Capital Allocators and Bloomberg Masters in Business, and spoken at CNBC‚Äôs Delivering Alpha, and Robin Hood‚Äôs Investors Conference, among others. He also chairs Rev, an annual data science conference for analytics leaders with 800+ attendees.
 
Matthew earned his A.B. from Harvard College, where he was President of The Harvard Crimson, and his M.B.A. from Harvard Business School, where he was a George F. Baker Scholar.

reasoning: Matthew Granade demonstrates characteristics of a Market Innovator and Thought Leader (L6) based on multiple strong indicators: 1) He co-founded Domino Data Lab, which has achieved significant scale serving 30% of Fortune 100 companies and secured backing from top-tier VC Sequoia Capital. 2) He has demonstrated repeated success in building and scaling significant business units, particularly at Point72 where he managed 200+ professionals and deployed $500M in venture investments. 3) He has established himself as a thought leader in data science and AI, chairing major conferences and appearing in prominent media outlets. 4) His track record includes successful board positions with exits (Say Technologies to Robinhood, Mirador to Cuna Mutual). While he could potentially qualify for L7, the lack of multiple confirmed $100M+ exits or clear unicorn valuations keeps this assessment at L6 with high confidence.

name: Chris Brummer
title: CEO, law professor, and independent director
location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
about:
Chris Brummer is the Agnes Williams Sesquicentennial Professor of Financial Technology at Georgetown Law, as well as the Founder and CEO of Bluprynt, the digital assets disclosure company.  He is a trusted advisor to policymakers, founders, firms, and regulators, at the highest levels, around the world.  As a thought leader, board director and and entrepreneur he has lent his expertise to leaders grappling with some of the most challenging puzzles facing innovation, technology, and financial regulation. 

Chris graduated summa cum laude from Washington University in St. Louis, earned a Ph.D from the University of Chicago and graduated from law school with honors from Columbia.

name: Saahil Kamath
title: Head of AI | VP @ Eltropy | Startup Founder | AI/ML Industry Leaders Forum Expert for CFIs
about:
I am on a mission to bring AI within the reach of 150 million people, revolutionizing the way Community Financial Institutions (CFIs) operate. As Head of AI at Eltropy, the fastest-growing private company in Silicon Valley, I lead the development of transformative and safe AI solutions that empower CFIs with cutting-edge technologies.

Entrepreneurial Journey & AI Leadership

Before joining Eltropy, I founded Marsview.ai, an AI startup that was acquired by Eltropy in 2022. Under my leadership, Marsview was recognized as one of ‚ÄòThe 10 Hottest SaaS Startups‚Äô (2020) and won ‚ÄòBest Use of AI in Fintech‚Äô (2021). Prior to that, I launched Visio.ai, an AI-powered video surveillance platform for smart cities, schools, and hospitals‚Äîearning recognition as one of India‚Äôs ‚ÄòTop 10 AI Solution Providers‚Äô in 2018.

AI Innovation & Industry Impact

My journey in AI began with deep research at IISc Bangalore, collaborating with Boeing, where my team secured multiple patents in AI and Deep Learning. Today, at Eltropy, I drive AI product strategy, market expansion, and innovation, ensuring CFIs stay ahead in the AI revolution.

Beyond my role at Eltropy, I advise and mentor early-stage startups on product strategy, go-to-market execution, and scaling AI businesses.

üí° Passionate about AI-driven innovation, fintech transformation, and startup growth.
üöÄ Let‚Äôs connect and shape the future of AI together.

name: Michael Beber
title: Co-founder and Board Member at Exiger, Series A Investor and Board Member at Accordion, Business Creator/Innovator, Growth Visionary, Acquisition Advisor, Investor
about:
Michael Beber is a Co-founder and Chair of Cretiv, the Beber Family Office.  Prior to forming Cretiv, in July 2013, Beber co-founded and was the President & CEO of Exiger which was sold in 2024 to The Carlyle Group and Insight Partners for $1.2 Billion. Michael remains an investor in Exiger and a member of the Board of Directors. 

Beber has held C-suite roles including CEO, Chief Strategic Development Officer and President at companies including Kroll, Marsh & McLennan (MMC) and Altegrity.  At Kroll, Beber‚Äôs acquisitions team made 35 acquisitions ultimately selling Kroll to MMC in 2004 for $1.95 Billion.

Beber is known for foreseeing opportunity and taking decisive action when others might hesitate. He views uncertainty as a catalyst for growth, seeking out and thriving in dynamic environments, companies, and markets where change is constant.  He is known as one of the lead people to introduce the concept of consolidating accounting firms through PE to both the PE and CPA firm markets advising as an Entrepreneur in Residence at MidOcean Partners (2007/2008) and New Mountain Capital (2012/2013).  

Beber is a CPA (retired) from Toronto, Canada.  He was a Co-founder and Managing Director at Lindquist Avey, Partner and Head of Forensic and Investigative Accounting at BDO Canada, a Senior Manager at KPMG, and a Senior Accountant at PWC.  

Beber is a well-known forensic accountant and testifying expert who led numerous high profile commercial litigation matters and forensic investigations on behalf of corporations, PE firms and regulators involving complex commercial cases, fraud, the quantification of economic damages, funds tracing and transactional due diligence; all in a broad range of industries and businesses.  Beber led the sale of Lindquist Avey to Kroll in June 1998.

____

Proven innovator, business builder, company leader and public company executive officer in rapidly evolving professional, technology-enabled and software business and information services companies.  

Focused on solutions related to anti-corruption, anti-money laundering, due diligence, litigation management, security, governance, risk and compliance. 

Unique skills:
-Growth through innovation
-Repurposing and repositioning capabilities
-Broadening and extending offerings
-Simplifying the complex
-Team building, collaboration and motivation
-Delivering executable plans
-Value creation
-Delivering outcomes

name: William Santana Li
title: CEO Knightscope (NASDAQ: KSCP)
about:
William (‚ÄúBill‚Äù) Santana Li has served as our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (‚ÄúCEO‚Äù) of Knightscope, Inc. (NASDAQ: KSCP) since April 2013. Mr. Li is an American entrepreneur with over 30 years of experience from working in the global automotive sector and founding and leading a number of startups. From 1990 to 1999, Mr. Li held multiple business and technical positions at Ford Motor Company across four continents.

His positions at Ford ranged from component, systems, and vehicle engineering with the Visteon, Mazda, and Lincoln brands; to business and product strategy on the United States youth market, India, and the emerging markets in Asia-Pacific and South America; as well as the financial turnaround of Ford of Europe. In addition, he was on the ‚ÄúAmazon‚Äù team, which established an all-new modular plant in Brazil. Subsequently, he served as Director of Mergers & Acquisitions.

After internally securing $250 million in financing, Mr. Li founded and served as COO of GreenLeaf LLC, a Ford Motor Company subsidiary that became the world‚Äôs second largest automotive recycler. Under his leadership, GreenLeaf grew to more than 600 employees, 20 locations worldwide, and annual sales of approximately $150 million. At the age of 28, Bill was the youngest senior executive at Ford Motor Company worldwide.

After successfully establishing GreenLeaf, Mr. Li was recruited by SoftBank Venture Capital to establish and serve as the President and CEO of the Model E Corporation, a newly established automobile manufacturer that focused on the ‚ÄúSubscribe and Drive‚Äù model in California. Mr. Li also founded Carbon Motors Corporation in 2003, and as its Chairman and CEO until February 2013, focused it on developing the world‚Äôs first purpose-built law enforcement patrol vehicle.

Mr. Li earned a BSEE from Carnegie Mellon University and an MBA from the University of Detroit Mercy.
notable_achievements: Youngest senior executive at Ford Motor Company worldwide at age 28; Led GreenLeaf LLC to become the world's second largest automotive recycler with over 600 employees and $150 million in annual sales; Pioneered the 'Subscribe and Drive' model with Model E Corporation; Developed the world's first purpose-built law enforcement patrol vehicle at Carbon Motors Corporation
reasoning: William Santana Li demonstrates a strong track record of scaling companies and leading significant operations. His current company Knightscope has achieved a NASDAQ IPO, and he has previously founded/led multiple ventures including GreenLeaf ($150M revenue), Model E Corporation (SoftBank-backed), and Carbon Motors. His early career at Ford Motor Company showed exceptional leadership, becoming the youngest senior executive worldwide. While he hasn't yet achieved a billion-dollar exit that would qualify for L6+, his consistent pattern of building and scaling companies, combined with the successful IPO of Knightscope, places him solidly at L5 as a Growth-Stage Entrepreneur.

name: Brian Sathianathan
title: Serial Entrepreneur, Co-Founder Iterate.ai, Member of Apple's first iPhone Team
about:
I am a serial entrepreneur, board member, executive, inventor and was one of the members of the first iPhone teams. I am currently in the process of building a fantastic company in the low-code AI space called Iterate.ai.

2001-07: I worked at Apple for eight years. I became one of the early key members of Apple's Secret Products working on the first iPhone. After architecting and building their internal enterprise platforms and security applications, I moved into the consumer product area and led software development teams at Apple's Secret Product (NPI) group for a few years. My team worked on the first iPhone's security and provisioning system that outlasted device unlock attacks.

2007-11: After Apple, I was the Founder & President of Avot Media, enabling streaming video into a wide variety of mobile smartphones and tablets. We grew revenue locally & internationally and sold that startup to Smith Micro, a public company in Orange County.

2011-13: Post Avot, because of my passion for startups, I joined Turner Broadcasting and helped start Media Camp. During this time, we engaged on the business side and made 13 seed investments into media startups. Two of them exited shortly post-investment.

I am a builder at heart. I love creating startups and products. I am also the co-host of a popular innovation podcast called: thisweekininnovation.com.

about:
Gregarious ‚ÄúGreg‚Äù Narain has been at the forefront of social media marketing, influencer marketing, and product marketing for more than 20 years. In his illustrious career, Greg has helped drive marketing verticals ‚Äì such as content management, email and customer relationship systems, and marketing research ‚Äì with a focus on product development and launches.

Greg has been the founder of numerous startups in the influencer marketing space, as well as being the founder of his own agency that worked with startups and Fortune 500 companies on product development and business strategies. Gregarious has spoken internationally at many leading industry events, including Cannes Lions Innovation, DreamForce, NAB, SXSW, AWS Re:Invent and is involved with numerous nonprofits and organizations. He holds a Bachelor of Arts from New York University in Sociology.

name: Chris Gibson
title: Co-Founder/CEO & Director of Recursion: a biotech scaling more like a tech company - Nasdaq:RXRX | Boards: Cellino, BioHive, Salt Lake Tribune | Angel/friend of deeptech founders and dreamers
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
about:
I work with amazing scientists, engineers, operators and administrators to invent technological solutions to solve challenges in medicine and biology.  

The primary focus of my career has been the founding and building of Recursion, a digital biology company industrializing drug discovery and beyond. Recursion combines automation, artificial intelligence, biology and chemistry with a highly cross-functional team to discover medicines that will change the lives of patients and their families. Over time, as our rich, relatable and proprietary database of petabytes of biological data has grown, we are increasingly moving from an unbiased brute-force search to an autonomous prediction, learning and inference system. The result will turn drug discovery into a many-parameter optimization problem, shift failure earlier in the process and allow for massive parralellization. I believe success of this endeavor in the long run will result in better medicines more quickly and at a reduced cost to society.

I have led the company as CEO since founding through public listing, 4 clinical-stage programs and more than 50 pre-clinical and discovery programs in diverse therapeutic areas. I expect to spend my career building Recursion to achieve our critical mission to decode biology to radically improve lives.

I supplement this work helping advise, mentor and invest in a new generation of diverse biotech founders with passion to make the world better through science.

name: Matthew Zeiler
title: Founder & CEO at Clarifai | Pioneering the full stack AI platform
about:
I founded Clarifai in 2013 shortly after completing my PhD at New York University. Before that, I had the privilege of working alongside renowned machine learning pioneers Geoff Hinton, Rob Fergus, Yann LeCun, and Jeff Dean. This experience really cultivated my passion for deep learning which is the foundation for all the AI we do at Clarifai.

Today, I work with some of the most brilliant people in the industry in order to simplify the complexities of getting AI into production for organizations. We have built the full stack AI platform having all the tools you need in one place for data labelling, data management, training and evaluation of models, elastic model inference, model monitoring, active learning, streamlit UI modules, and much more. Collectively this streamlines for our customers their procurement, legal/security review, and development/maintenance when applying AI to production use cases. Join us on our mission to Empower developers to quickly co-create, share, and use The World AI(TM) in production.

Amir Husain is an entrepreneur, AI technologist, and author based in Austin, Texas. He is a recipient of Austin‚Äôs Top Entrepreneur award, UT Austin‚Äôs highest honor‚Äîthe Presidential Citation‚Äîand has been inducted into UT Austin‚Äôs College of Natural Sciences Hall of Honor, as well as Austin‚Äôs 40 Under 40. His ventures have received multiple recognitions, including placement on CNBC‚Äôs Fastest Growing Companies list and the World Economic Forum‚Äôs Unicorn list.

Amir currently serves as Chairman of WorldQuant Foundry, a venture incubator; SpecFive, a mesh networking company; Argon, a humanoid robotics company focused on manufacturing applications; and Navigate, a decentralized data platform. He also serves on the University of Texas at Austin‚Äôs President‚Äôs Advisory Board, the Advisory Board of the Department of Computer Science, and the Board of Global Venture Bridge.

Amir founded SparkCognition, an industrial AI company that achieved a $1.4 billion valuation under his leadership, and SGS (now Avathon Government), a defense technology company chaired by former Deputy Secretary of Defense Robert Work. He also founded and led SkyGrid, a joint venture created in partnership with Boeing.

He has been awarded over 30 patents in AI and distributed systems and has served on NATO‚Äôs Innovation Advisory Board. His work has been featured in publications such as the BBC, Fortune, Forbes, and Proceedings from the U.S. Naval Institute.

He is the author of several books, including The Sentient Machine, Generative Art, and Generative AI for Leaders. He is also a co-author of Hyperwar: Conflict and Competition in the AI Century, and a regular contributor to Forbes. His new book, The Cybernetic Society, will be published by Hachette in August 2025.

name: Satish Movva
title: Founder & C.E.O at CarePredict, Inc
about:
My latest Company, CarePredict has a simple goal: making it easier to take care of and look out for Seniors. I‚Äôve invented a wearable device called 'Tempo', the first designed for the elderly, which learns their activities of daily living and compiles these patterns into an individual's ‚ÄòRhythm Journal‚Äô. Analyzing these patterns provides meaningful context and early or just-in-time alerts to loved ones and caregivers when things may be going wrong. It‚Äôs my best invention yet.

Prior to CarePredict, I founded ContinuLink, an innovative Home-care, Medical Staffing and Hospice IT SaaS platform which processed $550m in customer transactions in 2012. We sold the Company to Procura in 2011 and I exited in 2013.

Innovation and healthcare have been constant themes throughout my career - I‚Äôm passionate about exploring and finding new ways to tackle old and new problems. I get a tremendous amount of satisfaction from being both a catalyst and driver of the innovation process.

I‚Äôve got almost 3 decades of progressively senior IT sector experience and have spent the last 2 decades focused on Healthcare. I‚Äôve been fortunate to have more than my fair share of firsts: I developed the first hypertext document management system with relevance ranked search, the first Physician Charge Capture mobile device, a highly innovative and widely acclaimed home care, medical staffing and hospice SaaS platform, and now the first wearable device to monitor Seniors and track behaviors via activity and location within their own home.

Get in touch with me if you share my interest in Technology or want to discuss CarePredict.

[SuppCo]

name: Kakul Srivastava
title: CEO, Splice. Helping empower music creators everywhere.
about:
Kakul Srivastava is an award-winning entrepreneur whose mission is building companies that empower creators, grow communities and create great customer experiences. She is the CEO of Splice, the world's leading platform for music creators. Before Splice, Kakul was most recently Vice President of Creative Cloud Experience and Engagement at Adobe. Prior to that, Kakul was the Vice President of Product & Marketing at GitHub, helping empower the world‚Äôs largest community of coders, while building a high-growth enterprise business.
Earlier in her career, Kakul helped build some of the most iconic consumer tech products -- Adobe's Photoshop line of software, Flickr, Yahoo! Mail, and WeWork Commons. She was also the founder and CEO of Tomfoolery, Inc., a venture-backed start-up dedicated to improving how teams work which was bought by Yahoo in 2014.
Kakul‚Äôs success as a technology executive is founded on her deep Product Management experience and her ability to forge cross-functional relationships that enable companies to build great products and customer experiences. Her superpower is in combining technical competence with empathy and humility, and a passion for building great teams.
Kakul is a graduate of MIT with a BSc in Mechanical Engineering, and also holds an MBA from the University of California, Berkeley Haas School of Business. She is a sought-after Board Advisor for her direct and human-centered approach to solving complex problems in technical and mission-driven start-ups and nonprofits. She lives in the Bay Area with her husband and two children.


Specialties: Strategy Development, General Management, M&A, Strategic Investments, Product Management, Product Marketing, Social Software, Operations Management, Organizational Design and Development, Customer Care, Community Management, Growth Management, Process Design

As founder and CEO of SPLiCE , we make a difference every day as a Brand Owners Think-Tank. My thought leadership experience includes global management for Fortune 100 companies, solution providers and manufacturers. Design output includes directing business strategic planning, quality assurance risk, training and marketing.

name: Michael E Murphy
title: Co-founder @ Prelude | Supply Chain AI | ex-Zara
about:
I‚Äôve spent the past 10+ years building and implementing tech to optimize supply chain and retail operations. If there‚Äôs one thing I‚Äôve learned about retail it‚Äôs that simply producing (or buying) great products is not enough‚Ä¶truly great companies know exactly how much to produce (or buy) and exactly where it needs to go.

The cannabis industry has entered a period of hyper-growth but its supply chain remains in its infancy. Everyone from consumer to cultivator has been impacted by this reality...and, in order for this industry to achieve its true, unbounded potential, the industry needs best-in-class, data-driven processes and platforms to help companies decide exactly how much to buy (or produce) and exactly where it needs to go.

Prelude is purpose-built to solve this problem at scale: first by helping dispensaries reduce out of stocks and overstocks and then by helping brands, manufacturers and cultivators effortlessly use this demand data to refine their product mix.

We're a young company that is proud to be helping our early customers:
- Increase gross profit by 50%+
- Reduce order costs by up to 30%
- Reduce inventory levels by up to 60%

If you want to talk about anything related to cannabis, supply chains, and purchasing/inventory strategy, just drop me a message.
reasoning: Michael Murphy appears to be an early-stage entrepreneur with relevant industry experience who has launched a promising startup (Prelude) in the cannabis supply chain space. While he has significant domain expertise from his time at Zara and 10+ years in supply chain optimization, this appears to be his first founder role. The company shows early traction with impressive customer metrics (50%+ gross profit increase, 30% order cost reduction), but is self-described as a 'young company'. name: Ajay Shah
title: CEO & Co-Founder at Cytovale | Pioneering Early Detection by Revealing the Biology of Sepsis | Expert in Cell-Based Imaging & Machine Learning | Driving FDA-Cleared Solutions to Save Lives
about: I‚Äôve always been fascinated by the intersection of urgency and innovation. The human body, when under threat, whispers signals of distress‚Äîbut too often, we fail to hear them in time.¬†My career has been a journey to change that narrative. As the co-founder and CEO of Cytovale, I lead a team dedicated to one mission: empowering clinicians to diagnose sepsis in the critical moments when lives hang in the balance. At Cytovale, we‚Äôve developed IntelliSep, a groundbreaking diagnostic tool that can identify sepsis in as little as 10 minutes.¬†When every second matters, that‚Äôs the difference between a life saved and a life lost. This work didn‚Äôt start with Cytovale‚Äîit‚Äôs the product of a career steeped in exploration, problem-solving, and an unyielding belief in the potential of science to transform healthcare. At the Harvard-MIT Division of Health Sciences and Technology, I had the privilege of developing a platform for isolating circulating tumor cells under the mentorship of two giants in the field, Mehmet Toner and Daniel Haber.¬†That experience wasn‚Äôt just about lab work; it was a masterclass in what happens when innovation meets collaboration. Before Cytovale, I co-founded two life sciences companies, one of which was acquired in 2012. Those experiences taught me the delicate art of translating complex science into tangible solutions that not only work but also resonate with investors, clinicians, and patients. What drives me now is the same question that drove me then: How can we use technology to solve the problems that matter most?¬†For me, it‚Äôs about more than engineering solutions; it‚Äôs about listening to the clinicians on the frontlines and partnering with investors who believe in the vision as much as the metrics. It‚Äôs about being agile enough to seize the unexpected opportunities that come your way but grounded enough to value the trusted advice of those who‚Äôve walked this road before. Today, Cytovale isn‚Äôt just an idea‚Äîit‚Äôs a reality with FDA-approved technology, paying customers, and a growing impact.¬†But for me, it‚Äôs just the beginning. Because innovation isn‚Äôt a destination‚Äîit‚Äôs a mindset. And when you get it right, it‚Äôs nothing short of revolutionary. Want to know more about what drives me and the work we‚Äôre doing at Cytovale? Check out this interview. Let‚Äôs transform what‚Äôs possible in healthcare‚Äîone diagnostic breakthrough at a time.

Anne is also the author of ‚ÄúThe Career Engagement Game ‚Äì Shaping Careers for an Agile Workforce‚Äù and now a Forbes endorsed author with the release of ‚ÄúThe Talent Revolution‚Äù this year.

With a lifelong drive to help people fulfill their potential at work and future-proof organizations, Anne led several other companies before Fuel50 and worked for 20 years as an Organizational Psychologist, executive career coach, and corporate employment strategist.

name: Matthew Baird
title: Always building
about:
Outstanding engineering and product leader with over 20 years of start-up and top 10 public company experience.

3X successful startup founder, including AtScale, the leading big data analytics, and data virtualization company.

A regular speaker at major big data events, including Strata, Big Data World, Open Data Science, AI, and Big Data Innovation Summit, Big Data World, TheCube, Data Day.

Multiple patent holder in the field of Big Data and Analytics.

An accomplished author of successful print books and online content. Avid listener, a direct and expressive communicator, with an ability to explain deep technology to stakeholders building strong relationships across the business and beyond.

Leading voice for diversity and inclusion on the teams I support.

Why did I do all this?

Data-driven decisions are at the heart of modern enterprises. I have spent the entirety of my career building data platforms and applications that allow people to make data-driven decisions for the purpose of Digital Transformation. I enjoy building software in fields that involve human behavior, big data, and machine learning/prediction.

I enjoy building nimble, innovative product development teams that outperform the competition.

I am very hands-on with experience in both enterprise and consumer internet. I've accumulated a considerable amount of experience with Open Source software, both from the technical point of view, practical use, and legal issues associated with larger software vendors.

I have decades of experience running large complex global teams on software projects from both the engineering and product management side. My teams regularly give me feedback that the teams we've built are the highest performing teams they've ever been on.

I have a strong executive presence and am the go-to executive sponsor for interfacing with customers and prospects to support client implementations, sales, and customer success.

I am particularly well suited for both new development and situations requiring fundamental changes to optimize innovation and throughput on an existing team.

In short, I am a quick learning problem solver who loves building teams that build phenomenal software that delights customers.

Specialties: Big Data. Enterprise cloud-based SaaS, people & team leadership, organization & process design. Continuous Deployment: Predictive/adaptive real time analytics. Lean startup/Agile & Customer Development.

name: David Fried
title: CEO Evolv. Figuring out ways to improve people's health through technology.
about:
I am a highly experienced technology specialist having worked in startups and established companies for over 25 years in Healthcare, Digital Media, Interactive Marketing, Hardware and Software development. I acutally started my working life as an Architect.

My personal goal has always been to work on projects and products that combine Creativity, Design and Technology and which push the boundaries of each. I'm a hands-on executive who loves taking part in the creative process from start to finish. 

I've been responsible for very different roles during my career;  from start-up founder, to content creator, to heading up business development to product manager to CEO. I'm not afraid of taking on any task within an organisation and have shown that I can lead interdepartamental teams to assure successful project and product outcomes. 

I'm often dealing with very different people in my day-to-day, from potential clients in large international firms, SMES, government agencies and institutions, technology partners, suppliers as well as internally witho our own programmers, designers and sales staff.  Another important part of my job is evangelising about our products and services to an international client base, which means quite a bit of travelling, something I love to do. 

I'm currently focussed on the use of Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality technologies in physical and cognitive rehabilitation and prevention to improve patient outcomes. My goal is to make highly specialised rehabiliation and prevention treatments affordable and available to use directly in the home.

about:
Mike Ellenbogen is Founder and Chief Innovation Officer of Evolv Technology (NASDAQ: EVLV), a company dedicated to transforming public safety through advanced sensor and AI-driven solutions. Prior to assuming his current role at Evolv, Mr. Ellenbogen served as the Company‚Äôs CEO from 2013 to 2020.  Since inception, Evolv has been at the forefront of protecting people from threats like gun and bomb violence, leveraging cutting-edge technology to address evolving security challenges.

Mike‚Äôs career spans over 25 years in the physical security and detection industry. He founded and led Reveal Imaging Technologies, growing it into a leader in X-ray imaging and automated detection for aviation security.  Reveal was acquired by SAIC in 2010. Prior to Evolv, he served as an Executive in Residence at General Catalyst Partners, advising and investing in early-stage technology companies focused on sensors and analytical instruments.

With a background in physics from Colgate University and 20+ patents in inspection and detection technologies, Mike brings a unique ability to connect user needs with technical innovation. His work continues to influence advancements in security technology, combining market-driven research with the development of next-generation solutions.

name: Dominic Giglio
title: Co-founder / CIO at Rad NFTV
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I started my journey 10 years ago when I moved to New York with nothing more than $3,000 in my pocket and the dream of a better life. Over the course of the first five years I worked for various financial institutions eventually acquiring my Series 7 and 63 securities licenses. Finishing my life in the securities industry as an independent trader after the 2008 financial crisis, I decided to rededicate myself to my education and the world of technology I'd left behind. After enrolling in the Computer Science program at The City University of New York (CUNY) I threw myself into the burgeoning world of web design. After mastering HTML, CSS and Javascript I moved on to more dynamic languages like PHP and Ruby, and their associated frameworks: WordPress, CakePHP, Lithium, Sinatra and Ruby on Rails. In addition to my skills with dynamic web design languages, I've also built programs with C, Java, Python and Microsoft's Assembly language.

I am currently the Co-Founder and Chief Information Officer (CIO) at Little Star Media Inc / Rad NFTV, a technology platform which puts people at the center of experiences. We have worked with companies like DKNY, Belvedere Vodka, Uber, and Dining Out Magazine.

name: Jeremy B.
title: Professional
about:
Jeremy is a 3x founder & currently serves as the CEO and Co-founder of RAD Intel. Having experienced the highs and lows associated with shepherding innovation through disruptive products, Jeremy deeply understands the challenges behind pushing the boundaries of what's possible.  

His fascination with AI ignited back in 2012, prompting him to co-found Trendy Butler, where he assumed the role of CEO and exited in late 2017.  Jeremy is a frequent speaker at the USC Marshall School of Business and a prominent thought leader within local entrepreneurial circles. His notable initiative, founded in 2016, is OSF/LA, a platform dedicated to raising awareness and funds for the Orphaned Starfish Foundation (OSF). Ali Albazaz is the founder & CEO of Inkitt, the world‚Äôs first data-driven, reader-powered content house, on a mission to democratize the publishing industry. Through Inkitt‚Äôs platform, writers can publish their manuscripts to receive reader feedback for free. At the same time, Inkitt‚Äôs algorithm analyzes reader engagement with every story to predict each novel‚Äôs potential for mainstream success. 

By eliminating subjectivity from the publishing process, Inkitt is able to identify top-selling content that may have otherwise been passed on or never discovered due to publishers‚Äô personal opinions or aspiring authors‚Äô inaccessibility to writing and publishing means.

Writers with well-performing books are then offered a publishing deal through Inkitt‚Äôs sister app Galatea. Our systematic and data-driven approach has already proven successful: 1 out of every 2 Galatea authors have crossed the $100,000 sales mark, a 16x higher hit rate than the best publishers on Amazon Kindle.

Want to join our team? https://www.inkitt.com/jobs

name: Kamran Khan
title: CTO @ Slang. Engineer, machine-learning and data scientist, product designer, leader.
about:
I'm an engineer with a diverse background in software development, AI/ML research and data science, UI/UX design and implementation, and management. I lead Slang's technical efforts as co-founder and CTO.

‚òû Software development
I've got extensive experience in many modern software-development ecosystems, including web (on the front end: the usual languages plus TypeScript, Elm, Reason, usually on React; on the back end: Ruby, Python, Go, etc.) and mobile (both hybrid with React Native and Flutter and native with Swift and Kotlin). I've also got a lot of experience ‚Äî non-professional, albeit ‚Äî with some more niche languages like Prolog and Haskell. I am very comfortable with database management, infrastructure maintenance, and most other corners of dev-ops.

‚òû Artificial intelligence and machine learning
My machine-learning background is rooted in computer vision, but the ML research I lead today is focused on natural-language processing, particularly in domain-specific ASR, WSD, and MT. My academic background is in theoretical computer science (specifically, computability and complexity theory) and mathematics.

‚òû Design
I at least like to think I have a good eye for design. I'm very comfortable with product design/management, UX optimization, branding, typography/typesetting, and print design. I'm honing my illustration chops. (I've got a bunch of experience with video post-production, too, for the rare-but-fun occasion that comes up.)

‚òû Management
I've grown with Slang from zero employees to 60+ and all along the way I've been sharpening my skills in team management, organization structuring, culture building, recruitment, finance and operations, fundraising, and coaching.

I like music, bikes, and chess, too.

name: James Crawford
title: AI Researcher and Entrepreneur
about:
James has over 20 years of experience in leading edge software research and development.  He is currently CEO and Founder of Orbital Insight -- an A-round startup funded by Sequoia Capital and Google Ventures. Orbital Insight processes satellite and aerial imagery at petabyte scale to understand national and world-wide socio-economic trends.  

Previously he was SVP of Science and Engineering at the Climate Corporation through its $1B acquisition by Monsanto.  Before his time at Climate he was CTO and Software Architect at Moon Express -- a company with the modest goal of putting the first commercial robot on the Moon and winning the Lunar X-Prize.  Previous to that he was engineering Director of Google Book Search where he was in charge of Google's project to scan, index, and make searchable the world's books, as well as the Book and Magazine stores within Google Play.

He also served as EVP Engineering at Composite Software -- a startup focusing on data visualization that recently agreed to be acquired by Cisco for $180M.  Before coming to Composite, James lead Autonomy and Robotics at Ames Research Center, NASA‚Äôs center of excellence for information technology, where he was responsible for almost 100 researchers. 

Prior to joining NASA, James led the Optimization team at i2 Technologies and worked at AT&T Bell Laboratories and co-founded the Computational Intelligence Research Laboratory (CIRL) at the University of Oregon.  

James has authored over fifteen papers in referred journals and conferences, and holds five patents.  

James holds PhD and Master‚Äôs degrees in Computer Science from the University of Texas at Austin, and a BA in Math and Computer Science from Rice University.

Specialties: Executive Technology Management, Enterprise Software, Artificial Intelligence, Autonomy and Robotics, Supply Chain Planning, Data integration

name: Hardika Shah
title: Kinara Capital Founder & CEO | Transforming Lives via Financial Inclusion
about:
I am the Founder & CEO of Kinara Capital, a fast-growing fintech driving financial inclusion of small business entrepreneurs in India. Solely dedicated to last-mile #FinancialInclusion of the MSME sector in India, we are nearing USD $1 billion in cumulative disbursements that has empowered over 100,000 MSME entrepreneurs leading to wide job creation in local economies, income generation and transformed lives across 100+ cities in India. 

Before founding Kinara Capital, I spent two decades as a management consultant with Accenture, managing billion-dollar client projects across industries and geographies. My journey into social entrepreneurship was fueled by my decade of experience with pro-bono mentoring at social impact programs with institutions such as Santa Clara University, Stanford University, Accenture Development Partnerships, the Acumen Fund, and Columbia Business School.

I hold an MBA from a joint program with Columbia Business School (Columbia University) and Haas School of Business (UC Berkeley) and earned my B.A. in Computer Science from Knox College in Illinois.

name: Palash Jain
title:

33 Years of Experience:

* 5 Years in Silicon Valley(USA)
* Sapient

9 HARD TO BELIEVE YET TRUE STORIES:

1. (1985) From Rejection to Recognition: He didn't get into IIT, but by 2008, he was the keynote speaker at IIT Delhi and spoke at multiple events.

2. (1988) Under the Radar, Until He Wasn't: In school, he was never among the top 3 students in his class of 40. Yet, in 1988, he earned a National Scholarship from the Government of India for securing 2nd position at University level in Mathematical Statistics.

3. (1995) Tech Leader & DJ: In California, he balanced his tech career with his passion for music, co-hosting DJ events on weekends.

4. (1999) Closer to Home: Returned to India on 30-Dec-99 to help set up company's outsourcing center. Later surrendered Green Card in 2005.

5. (2004) No Harvard degree but did a 2-year project working with senior management folks at Harvard University.

6. (2007) Humble Beginnings to Corporate Heights: Around 1980, he rented a bicycle for just Rupee 1 ($0.1). Fast forward to 2007, while battling a brief but life-threatening illness in hospital, he received a call from an executive search firm representing Google, offering him the position to head Google's Gurgaon office / India's core operations.

7. (2009) Diverse Experience, Global Impact: After Lehman Brothers crash, Google paused its India expansion, leading him and other leaders to leave. Following stints in California, Bangalore, Hyderabad, he became an entrepreneur & launched a B2C venture in Delhi. Though it didn't sustain, it provided invaluable lessons. He later teamed up with his son to grow AMBER, an innovative Enterprise SaaS HR product. 

8. (2018) Life Motto: Despite losing his 18-year son to cancer in 2018 and facing near bankruptcy in 2019, he believes life has its highs & lows, but persistence and continuous learning ensure the universe has something positive in store.

9. (2025) Over last 10 years, this Father-Son startup duo, together with Varun Puri & a team of 120, has expanded their customer base to over 300 globally. 

As a leader, he helps corporate employees feel heard while providing CXOs valuable analytical insights on what's working well and areas needing improvement.

OPEN TO CONNECTIONS: 
Instead of Insta/FB, he prefers meeting people F2F to exchange stories. If you want to discuss gauging employee sentiment using AI, scaling a startup 10x with OKRs and consulting rigour, or simply enjoy a fun chat over tea, he's all ears, loves wearing a smile. name: Paulo Rodrigues
title: CTO at QMENTA Inc
about:
I‚Äôm working towards creating value by bringing software engineering and neuroimaging together to make a true impact in healthcare. With my colleague Vesna, we grew the QMENTA team, raised funding, and reached clients from various top-notch research institutions all around the world.
Our aim is to help doctors provide a better diagnosis and treatment for patients with brain diseases, in addition to accelerating the discovery and development of new treatments by supporting the clinical trial process. 

Expertise in entrepreneurship, neuroimaging, neuroscience, computer graphics, image analysis, software engineering, mobility, and visualization

Regarding my background, I finished my PhD at the Biomedical Image Analysis group of the Biomedical Engineering Department of Eindhoven University of Technology, The Netherlands. My dissertation, defended on 19th of April 2011, was on 'Homogeneity based segmentation and enhancement of Diffusion Tensor Images - A white matter processing framework'.
Afterwards, I moved to Barcelona where I was a research associate at the Individual Differences Lab of University of Barcelona, executing social psychology experiments and neuroimaging. At the same time, I was working for Event-Lab that creates virtual environments lab for neuroscience and technology for social psychology and neuroscience experiments.

In addition to my research career, I had a few of industry positions as software engineer: first, at an innovative mobile development company called MobiComp, in Portugal; then, in The Netherlands, at Quintiq, a company specialized in advanced planning and scheduling solutions.
education_2_degree: licenciate, Computer Science and Systems Engineering

I‚Äôm a neuroscientist turned entrepreneur ‚Äî building at the intersection of AI, neuroimaging, and human outcomes.

As Co-founder and CEO of QMENTA, I lead a global team focused on transforming how we diagnose and treat brain diseases. We use advanced imaging biomarkers and machine learning to accelerate clinical trials and decode complex brain data ‚Äî helping clinicians and researchers go from guesswork to precision.

I‚Äôve spent over a decade working with academic labs, startups, and biopharma to bring clarity to complexity ‚Äî and move ideas out of the lab and into lives.

My approach?
	‚Ä¢	Think in systems
	‚Ä¢	Build with empathy
	‚Ä¢	Measure what matters

Brain health isn‚Äôt a buzzword. It‚Äôs the foundation for how we live, work, and lead. I‚Äôm here to make sure we stop treating it like a black box.

Quietly obsessed with where neuroscience meets performance ‚Äî and what it means to build companies that think biologically, not just financially.

name: Tom Wagner
title: Momentarily Unstructured | No Title / Many Titles / Pick One
about:
Tom Wagner is the founder and former CEO and chairman of Berkshire Grey (BG), a company pioneering AI-driven robotics for logistics and serving some of the largest customers in logistics and retail. Having gone from whiteboards and duct tape to venture-backed growth, to products in operation with meaningful customers, to a public company, BG was acquired by SoftBank in 2023. As of this writing, BG holds more than 400 patents and the last publicly articulated revenue expectations were ~$100M in topline revenue. Today, BG is continuing its positive trajectory with announced special partnership(s), a few thoughtfully aligned lines of business serving material customers, and a seasoned management team of proverbial varsity players.

Prior to BG, Wagner served as Chief Technology Officer at iRobot, which at the time was a global leader in consumer robotics and robots for defense, industrial applications, and telepresence. Earlier in his career, he served as a program manager at the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), the technology agency of the U.S. Department of Defense, where he created and managed programs in artificial intelligence, robotics, communications, command and control, telehealth, connected devices, agent-based systems, and intelligent assistants.  Several of these programs and technologies transitioned to use and/or helped spawn commercially-focused companies and products. 

Before DARPA, Wagner served as a principal lead at Honeywell, a professor at the University of Maine, and held leadership and advisory roles in small and startup companies. His early experiences includes work at General Motors and various and sundry places and functions‚Äîfrom databases to manufacturing backpacks to establishing & managing a retail store to pumping gas.

He holds a Ph.D. in computer science and artificial intelligence from the University of Massachusetts Amherst, an M.S. in computer science from University of New Hampshire, and a B.S. in computer science from Michigan State.  Flowing from time spent in technology, work, and teaching, he has some appropriate number of publications and patents, awards, and a few former graduate students walking the world.

As part of TrueML I founded Engage, TrueML's first direct-to-consumer product. Engage took the TrueML experience a step further, enabling consumers to take control of their debts while providing them the tools and resources needed on their journey to financial health.

name: Christian Lutz
title: Founder & COO @ Tree.ly | Improve Climate. Remove Carbon with our wonderful forests | also cofounder of sms.at, uboot.com, ucp morgen, Impossible Project, Fatfoogoo, Crate.io | Keynote Speaker
about:
I am a climate impact leader and a seasoned technology entrepreneur with over 25 years of experience in building and scaling innovative companies. As the COO and Co-Founder of Tree.ly, I am on a mission to unlock the carbon sequestration potential of Europe's forests through a managed data platform that tracks tree-level data with measurement, reporting, verification, and certification. 

Tree.ly allows European forest owners to produce regional, high quality, certified CO2 credits (ex-post only, no prepayments), and then help to deliver those to enterprises supporting their path to net-zero. As such Tree.ly enables new income streams for forest owners that do not rely only on cutting down trees. We help forest owners manage their properties in a sustainable, CO2-optimisation, and climate-resilient manner, and get one step closer to our common goal: carbon net neutrality. 

In addition to my role at Tree.ly, since 2010 I also serve as supervisory board member of TGW Logistics Group, a leading $1Bn logistics innovator and as board director at the social impact-oriented trust "TGW Future Stiftung", the 100% owner of TGW Logistics Group. 

I am passionate about creating positive change for people and the planet through technology and entrepreneurship. Since 1999 I have successfully raised 20 VC rounds (from Seed to Series B, total $135M) for "my" companies and closed several exits, acquisitions, mergers in EU&USA. On the private side, besides family time, I love to play with high mountains in winter & summer and any sport on or below water. And I really like to cook and eat, and to travel.

name: Stefan Holzer
title: CTO and Co-Founder at Fyusion, Inc
about:
Stefan is the CTO and Co-Founder at Fyusion. Before Fyusion, he was affiliated with the Computer Vision group at the Institute for Computer Aided Medical Procedures (CAMP), a Ph.D. student at Technische Universitaet Muenchen (TUM), and a maintainer with the Point Cloud Library (PCL) project. His work has been published in all major conferences of his field and at the forefront in the field of computer vision. 

He was also affiliated with the German Aerospace Center (DLR), the Airbus group, the group of Dr. Andrew Davison at the Department of Computing at Imperial College London (ICL), and Microsoft Research Cambridge. Stefan gained experience in the industry while working with several companies, including Willow Garage (a pioneer in the field of personal robotics), Metaio (at the time the leading company in Augmented Reality, now acquired by Apple), and the European Aeronautic Defense and Space Company (EADS). Stefan collaborated and co-authored papers with many world-renowned experts in the field of computer vision, including Andrew Davison, Pushmeet Kohli, Vincent Lepetit, Marc Pollefeys, Jamie Shotton, and more. 

Stefan‚Äôs research work has been published in all major Computer Vision journals (IJCV,  TPAMI) and conferences (ICCV, CVPR, ECCV, BMVC, ACCV, IROS, ICRA). He is the recipient of an O-1 US visa.

title:

about:
A Healthcare and AI entrepreneur, investor, and advisor having helped raise over $100M in funding and founded multiple startups looking to change society to help us all live a better life both today and tomorrow. 

Ash is a technologist and data scientist deeply rooted in the application of big data to health and its intersection with design, and has worked with organizations in the United States, China, UK, Canada, Australia, France, Germany, India and Japan. He has worked with leading venture capital firms such as Sandbox Industries, Intel Capital, Khosla Ventures, Oak HC/FT, and many others to help realize a better tomorrow. 

Ash has founded multiple companies including WithMe Health, excelera.health, Lumiata, and DeepAffects. He is an active investor and advisor to both healthcare and AI companies: CareLoop, LoopHealth, PeerWell, MyoKardia, Ellipsis Health, NuBiome and ExtraaEdge. Beyond, he is also active speaker at conferences such as Health Datapalooza, Health 2.0, AMA, MIT AI, Nvidia GTC and others.

Before focusing on healthcare, over the last 25 years, he has researched, built and applied AI technologies with leading institutions and organizations, including the UCLA AI and Robotics Lab, MIT‚Äôs AI Lab, the MIT Media Lab, the US Navy and NASA. Ash graduated from Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) in both Computer Science and Mathematics, has published numerous papers, and has received patents in real-time unstructured semantic analysis. 

#Healthcare #AI #MIT

name: Dilawar Syed
title: Entrepreneur | Former Deputy Administrator, SBA; Special Representative, State Department
about:
Dilawar Syed is an entrepreneur and former U.S. cabinet official whose leadership has spanned various public and private sector organizations, including as Deputy Administrator for the U.S. Small Business Administration (SBA) and Special Envoy for Commercial Affairs at the State Department. In his career in Silicon Valley, Dilawar led and scaled ventures in AI, software, and consumer web. 

Dilawar‚Äôs most recent role as SBA Deputy Administrator began with a bipartisan vote of the U.S. Senate. Dilawar advanced the Biden Administration's priorities for small businesses by democratizing access to capital, government contracting, and entrepreneurship enablement, especially in the underserved and rural communities. He helped coordinate SBA‚Äôs disaster response after Hurricanes Helene and Milton in the Southeast, the Francis Scott Key Bridge collapse in Baltimore, MD, and the wildfires in Maui, HI.

As Special Envoy for Commercial Affairs at the Department of State, Dilawar served as America‚Äôs top commercial diplomat, championing U.S. companies in markets abroad. He mobilized private sector support for Ukraine after Russia's invasion, advocated for strategic deals in advanced tech, energy, aviation, and defense, and negotiated market access in his 24 bilateral engagements across the globe.

Dilawar has previously served as CEO of Lumiata, an AI healthcare company backed by Khosla Ventures and BlueCross BlueShields, and as President at Freshworks, where he founded the software company's North America business (IPO in 2021). Earlier, he held product leadership roles at Yahoo! and Siebel Systems. 

Dilawar‚Äôs civic entrepreneurship has spanned local, state, and federal governments. Appointed by President Obama in 2010 to the White House Advisory Commission on Asian Americans and Pacific Islanders, he led engagement with small businesses during the economic recovery. In 2017, he launched the California Entrepreneurship Task Force with the Governor‚Äôs Office to bridge Silicon Valley with rural communities and promote inclusive entrepreneurship.

Dilawar holds an MBA from The Wharton School and a BA in Computer Science and Economics from The University of Texas at Austin. He has returned to his alma mater as faculty and has launched a new public policy initiative at The LBJ School of Public Affairs to strengthen U.S. business competitiveness. He is currently advising several software companies as a board member.

name: K. J. Ray Liu
title: Founder, Chairman and CTO
about:
K. J. Ray Liu is the founder, former CEO, and now Chairman and CTO of Origin AI that pioneers AI for wireless sensing and indoor tracking. The invention of wireless AI won three prestigious CES Innovation Awards, including CES Best of Innovation in 2021.

Dr. Liu was 2022 IEEE President and CEO, and was the 2019 IEEE Vice President for Technical Activities and a member of IEEE Board of Director as Division IX Director in 2016-2017. He has also served as 2012-2013 President of IEEE Signal Processing Society, where he was Vice President for Publications and Editor-in-Chief of IEEE Signal Processing Magazine.

He was Distinguished University Professor, Distinguished Scholar-Teacher, and Christine Kim Eminent Professor of Information Technology of the University of Maryland, College Park, from where he retired after over three decades of career in education. His research contributions encompass broad aspects of signal processing and communications. He has trained over 70 doctoral/postdoctoral students, of which 10 are now IEEE fellows.
 
Dr. Liu is the recipient the 2021 IEEE Fourier Technical Field Award for Signal Processing, the 2016 IEEE Leon K. Kirchmayer Graduate Teaching Award, IEEE Signal Processing Society 2014 Norbert Wiener Society Award, and IEEE Signal Processing Society 2009 Claude Shannon-Harry Nyquist Technical Achievement Award. Recognized as a Web of Science Highly Cited Researcher, he is a Fellow of IEEE, American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS), and the U.S. National Academy of Inventors.

about:
My professional goal is to bridge the translational gap between business and scientific worlds.  Leadership, innovation, and commercialization are my passion. about:
As a co-founder of Plink, I am on a mission to create a delicious, healthy, and low-impact beverage that challenges the legacy of the soft drink industry. Plink is a revolutionary product that transforms water into a juicy, refreshing, and effervescent drink with 98% less carbon footprint and 99% less packaging than traditional beverages. 

I have experience in co-founding and scaling FMCG brands, as well as a background in event production and experiential events. I learned a lot from my previous venture, Wild Fizz Kombucha, where I helped grow an omni-channel brand with DTC, retail, and enterprise offerings, and managed a small team of employees and subcontractors. Unfortunately, we failed to survive the Covid-19 pandemic, but I gained valuable insights into the challenges and opportunities of the CPG sector, and the importance of starting right with sustainability and ethics at the core of the business. I believe that brands and products should not only fit the market, but also actively contribute to social and environmental causes. That's why I'm passionate about Plink and its potential to make a positive difference.

about:
As an accomplished executive with a blend of C-suite and startup experience in media and AI/ML, I bring a unique perspective to board service. My expertise spans executive leadership, revenue growth, digital transformation, GTM strategies, product development, operational excellence, and public speaking‚Äîskills critical to driving organizational success and shareholder value.

Boardroom Value Proposition:
‚Ä¢	Strategic Vision: Proven ability to align technology, strategy, and operations to drive growth and innovation.
‚Ä¢	Revenue Expertise: Deep experience in monetization strategies, revenue diversification, and market expansion.
‚Ä¢	AI/ML Insight: Hands-on leadership in AI/ML product development and application for business outcomes.
‚Ä¢	Governance Leadership: History of effective board service, fostering collaboration, and ensuring accountability.

As President/COO of RAI, an investor-backed AI/ML company, I led the commercialization of a cloud-based platform for media and entertainment companies. The platform analyzed audience metrics and video content to reveal what engages viewers, enabling customers like HBO, ABC, NBCU, and The Weather Channel to grow audiences and retention. Under my leadership, RAI was recognized as a top three AI platform by TechCrunch Disrupt and accepted into the NVIDIA Inception Program. My responsibilities included partnerships, sales, customer success, finance, platform feature development, and marketing‚Äîspanning product marketing, branding, and social media.

Prior to RAI, as SVP of Revenue & Business Development at Fisher Communications (FSCI), I managed nearly $200MM in annual revenue. I led a team of 174 professionals, overseeing strategy, execution, and revenue optimization. I also directed the Fisher Interactive Network, taking it to profitability, and was responsible for programming, content acquisition, retransmission negotiations, research, traffic operations, and enterprise-wide contracts.

Earlier, I led advertising sales departments for ABC and FOX stations in major markets, achieving consistent revenue growth and operational improvements.

Today I serve as Executive Chair of the 3 WTIA boards and on the board of Delta Dental. I served on the board of RAI as Secretary. Reflecting my dedication to community impact and organizational development, I was Chair/President of the Girl Scouts of Western Washington board.

Serve as an advisor to several AI based startups.

Specialties: Executive Leadership, Strategy, Go-to-Market (GTM), Revenue Development, Advertising, Marketing, Digital Transformation, AI/ML, and Governance.

name: Tom Chiarella
title: Founder at Level Up Live | Technological Innovation
about:
I am a business builder with extensive experience in the high-technology industry spanning Internet of Things (IoT), sensors, artificial intelligence, media, and enterprise software.  I‚Äôve directly worked for/with some of the most advanced and innovative companies in the world including Disney, Microsoft, GE and HBO.  I've also been involved with eight venture-backed startups as founder, investor, advisor and/or Board member, six of which had exits to publicly traded companies.

Over the last three years, I‚Äôve been involved in a project that brings together my love of high-tech with my passion for shooting sports.  Ever since I joined my university's international skeet team many, many years ago, I've had amazing experiences competing with men and women from all walks of life and from many countries around the world. It has been my dream to share that fun and camaraderie with others. I have imagined a place where shooting sports are accessible to everyone in a completely new format.  A place where the focus is sports and entertainment with live timing and scoring, leader boards and games designed for everyone from first timers to Olympic champions.  That place is called Level Up Live. 

In addition to amazing mechatronics technology - over 100 patents / inventions ‚Äì we've developed a core philosophy of social responsibility with respect to firearms.  Our guests will find no human shaped targets, silhouettes or zombies at Level Up Live, nor will they find guns and ammo for sale.  Rather, we hope they will find a modern, sophisticated, safe, inclusive and welcoming experience that is best shared with friends, family and coworkers time and time again.

My entire adult life has prepared me to make Level up Live the next big thing in technology-enabled sports and entertainment.

name: Ed Donner
title: Co-Founder & CTO at Nebula.io, repeat Co-Founder of AI startups, speaker & advisor on Gen AI and LLM Engineering
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I‚Äôm a technology leader and entrepreneur. I'm applying AI to a field where it can make a massive impact: helping people discover their potential and pursue their reason for being. But at my core, I‚Äôm a software engineer and a scientist. I learned how to code aged 8 and still spend weekends experimenting with Large Language Models and writing code (rather badly). If you‚Äôd like to join us to show me how it‚Äôs done.. message me!

As a work-hobby, I absolutely love giving talks about Gen AI and LLMs. I'm the author of a best-selling, top-rated Udemy course on LLM Engineering, and I speak at O'Reilly Live Events and ODSC workshops. It brings me great joy to help others unlock the astonishing power of LLMs.

I spent most of my career at JPMorgan building software for financial markets. I worked in London, Tokyo and New York. I became an MD running a global organization of 300. Then I left to start my own AI business, untapt, to solve the problem that had plagued me at JPM - why is so hard to hire engineers?

name: Yoram Cohen
title: Water Technology Innovator
about:
Dr. Yoram Cohen received his B.A.Sc., M.A.Sc., in 1975 and 1977, respectively, both in Chemical Engineering, from the University of Toronto, and his Ph.D. from the University of Delaware in 1981. He is a Distinguished Research Professor of Chemical and Biomolecular Engineering at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) and at the Institute of the Environment and Sustainability (UCLA). Dr. Cohen is an Adjunct Professor at Ben-Gurion University and was a Visiting Professor at the Technion (1987-1988), at Universitat Rovira i Virgili (1944) and a Distinguished Visiting Professor at Victoria University (2006). He is Director of the Water Technology Research (WaTeR) and a co-founder of the Center for Environmental Implications of Nanotechnology (CEIN) that received the 2012 California Governor‚Äôs Award in Green Chemistry. He was the founder and Director of the Center for Environmental Risk Reduction (1995-2006), and former Director of the UCLA Y&S Center for Israel Studies (2015-2020). 

Dr. Cohen received the 2019 AIChE Clarence (Larry) G. Gerhold Award from the separations Division, the 2003 Lawrence K. Cecil Award in Environmental Chemical Engineering from the AIChE and was elected AIChE Fellow in 2009, and as Fellow of the North American Membrane Society in 2022. He is a recipient of the 2008 Ann C. Rosenfield Community Partnership Prize, a County of Los Angeles Commendation, a State of California Senate Certificate of Recognition, and a Certificate of Special Congressional Recognition (US) in recognition of his contribution to legislation to protect public health and dedicated service to the community. 

Dr. Cohen is a recognized expert and technology innovator in water treatment and desalination, membrane separations, environmental impact assessment, toxicity modeling, machine learning and nanoinformatics. He has published over 280 research papers and book chapters in water technology, separations processes, transport phenomena, polymer science, and environmental engineering, in addition to five books (as Editor), and presented his work in 490 conference presentations and 190 invited talks. His research resulted in the development and deployment of advanced flexible, self-adaptive and energy optimal water desalination systems, new membranes and monitoring technology for membrane fouling, mineral scaling and membrane integrity. His research also focuses on  environmental protection efforts to promote water reuse, develop clean drinking water supplies for disadvantaged communities, and reduce risks from exposure to chemical contaminants.

name: Anthony Curreri
title: Founder, CEO at Roadly Logistics (We are hiring!)
about:
üöõ CEO | Logistics Innovator | Problem Solver

In a world where supply chains power everything, I make it my mission to provide shippers with dynamic, reliable solutions ‚Äì and most importantly, peace of mind.

The logistics industry is massive, but it‚Äôs also plagued with inefficiencies ‚Äì from late deliveries and limited transparency to compliance challenges, outdated tech, and even fraud. I‚Äôve seen these gaps firsthand, especially in the critical middle-mile segment for temperature-controlled shipments. That‚Äôs where I chose to make a difference.

I founded Roadly Logistics with a clear mission: deliver trust, transparency, and unmatched service in middle-mile freight. We‚Äôve grown rapidly by focusing on customer needs, leveraging technology, and building a team of top talent. Today, we‚Äôre proud to be a trusted partner for shippers across the country.

My passion goes beyond solving logistics problems. It‚Äôs about building teams, developing a winning culture, and empowering people to do their best work. As we continue to expand, I stay focused on resource planning, strategic growth, and ensuring that Roadly remains a leader in our space.

Grateful to lead this incredible team. Proud of what we‚Äôve built. Excited for what‚Äôs next. üöÄ

name: Michael Rosenberg
title: Strategic & Operational CFO | Scaling Companies, Leading Teams, Executing with Impact
about:
I step in when I‚Äôm needed most - when clarity, speed, and execution make the difference.

I‚Äôm a hands-on CFO and operator with 20+ years of global experience leading financial transformation, deal execution, and cross-border growth across startups, scale-ups, and post-acquisition environments. Primarily based in Tel Aviv and New York, I‚Äôve also worked extensively across Japan, Europe, and the UAE - bringing cultural fluency, strategic agility, and financial discipline to complex environments.

I‚Äôve raised and deployed over $300M in capital, led strategic exits, built finance and ops from the ground up, and driven M&A, corporate development, and business development initiatives that create durable enterprise value. From selling Edify to Avaya in under two years, to leading investor diligence, to closing multimillion-dollar partnerships - I know how to get deals done and move organizations forward.

Trusted by boards, founders, and shareholders alike, I bring clarity to complexity, alignment to uncertainty, and a bias for action when timing matters most.

Today, as co-founder of RoseMehl, I serve as a fractional CFO and strategic partner‚Äîhelping companies and family offices unlock value, regain control, and execute with confidence.

name: Guy Mounier
title: CEO at Aptivio, The only End-to-End Revenue AI Platform
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Successful Entrepreneur in Enterprise AI. Cumulative Sales of $100M/Raised $30M for 2 B2B SaaS Startups (1 successful exit, 1 asset acquisition). 

Capitalizing on the Paradigm shift in Revenue AI that started in FY2020/Post-Covid, where generative AI is leveraged to detect sales-ready opps, interested buyers, and warm intros.

In 2019, I co-founded Aptivio, the world's first and only end-to-end Revenue AI Platform for the entire Revenue team. We are on a mission to help 36 Million B2B Sellers uncover hidden revenue opportunities and build trusted client relationships. 

Prior to that, I co-founded and ran CustomerMatrix, a FinTech for Corporate KYC and Client Onboarding backed by HSBC Ventures and acquired (assets acq.) by Med Tech Group, a $100M IT Services firm.

Prior to CustomerMatrix, I co-founded, bootstrapped, and ran BA Insight to become the leader in Agile Information Integration Platform for improving employee and customer interactions. The Company has 10% of Fortune 1000 as Clients, Major Federal and Local Government Agencies, and over 2 million professional users. BA Insight was acquired by Upland Software Inc, a NASAQ-listed $315M Work Mgt. Software company.

I am part of the 2014 Young Leader program of the French American Foundation, dedicated to help strengthen the relationship between France and the United States. I volunteer and help fundraise on behalf of several non-profit organizations in the areas of STEM Education, High-Tech Accelerators, and Young Entrepreneurs.

I hold two Master's degrees, one in Mathematics from Harvard University, and one in Computer Science and Electrical Engineering from Ecole Centrale Paris.

name: Mike Currid, PMP
title: Founder - Matrix Business Concepts
about:
Innovation, determination, and commitment to the customer. I built Matrix Business Concepts on these simple principles. After 25 years of project controls experience, I knew there had to be a better way to provide the project management and oversight that sponsors required. I'm proud to say that 16 years of growth and success through customer satisfaction proves, we have.

Matrix has steadily and consistently grown from a single-member project controls provider to a project management and oversight (PMO) with over 120 FTE's and contractors. I believed passionately in the effect of investment in human capital on customer satisfaction. Matrix values nothing higher than their customers needs and the satisfaction of their employees who fulfill those needs. 

People want to work for Matrix; and when they want to work for Matrix, they want to work for our project sponsor. Matrix is proud of that.

Matrix only accepts the most highly motivated, focused and experienced industry professionals to join the Matrix family. Diversity of professional experience is the back-bone of Matrix Business Concepts and its precisely what allows Matrix to provide what other PMO's and staff augmentation companies cant; a self-managed, funding to close-out, team-oriented approach to project management and oversight over a broad range of disciplines.

To the Matrix team: Thank you for making this such a fulfilling venture. Your dedication to excellence did not go unnoticed. It is by your hand that Matrix Business Concepts continues to exceed customer expectations.

For those interested in joining the Matrix team, please reach out!

(877) 612-2166
MatrixPMO.com

name: Aaron Ganek
title: SaaS Expert | Startup Advisor | Storyteller
about:
I am a former founder turned startup advisor. I guide startups through the fundraising process, and the companies I've partnered with have collectively secured over $250M in investment.

My focus is on storytelling. I collaborate with founders and board members to create pitch decks that resonate with investors and clearly articulate a startup's value proposition.

I anchor my advice on one pivotal principle: the most important word in fundraising is 'momentum.' A standout pitch quickly highlights past successes and lays the groundwork for future opportunities, weaving a narrative of irresistible momentum.

Before becoming an advisor, I was a founder. My startup revolutionized file search for enterprise workers. I built a team of 10+, raised $7M, forged strong partnerships with Fortune 100 companies, and took a product from concept to market.

Whether plotting my next venture or advising fellow founders, my passion for startups remains steadfast.
