Teacher Raj Ridvan Singh is not only an award-winning social entrepreneur ‚Äî he is a living embodiment of the fight against poverty and inequality. His journey began in the harsh realities of early-2000s Cambodia, co-founding his first NGO at the age of 17 with nothing but determination and less than USD 1 in his pocket, 25 years ago. Amidst war-torn landscapes, he built community centres from scratch, taught tens of thousands of youth, and experienced firsthand the dignity and pain of poverty.

These formative years shaped not only his mission but his unshakeable conviction: poverty is not just a statistic, it has a face, a family, and a future that can be changed.

Today, Teacher Raj is the visionary founder and CEO of SOLS 24/7, a globally recognized social enterprise ecosystem transforming education, renewable energy, mental health, and technology inclusion for underserved communities across Southeast Asia. www.sols247.com

Impact at Scale:

Over 850,000 students directly empowered

More than 3 million lives impacted across 6 countries

Raised over RM 80 million for poverty alleviation and sustainable development

Malaysia‚Äôs No.1 Home Solar company, helping Malaysians save RM 30M+ annually

Petronas & 500 Startups-backed

His ventures include:

SOLS Foundation ‚Äî 25 years of free education, life skills and Energy access solutions for the poor

SOLS Energy ‚Äî 28MW of clean energy solutions 

ChargeSingh ‚Äî affordable EV infrastructure for home users

SOLS Edu ‚Äî mobile-first English learning platform with over 48,000 users

SOLS Smart ‚Äî Government and corporate training in English, Digital and AI skills

Social Empresa ‚Äî advancing green entrepreneurship and sustainable business solutions

Philosophy & Legacy
Teacher Raj has redefined what it means to be a social entrepreneur: blending profitability with purpose, success with service. He proves that impact work does not mean sacrifice of ambition ‚Äî rather, it amplifies it. From hand-building schools in Cambodian jungles to now leading multi-million dollar ventures, he lives by the belief:

‚ÄúService and education are not just acts of charity ‚Äî they are the blueprint for a life well-lived.‚Äù

He continues to mentor a new generation of changemakers, showing by example that you can fight poverty, build prosperity, and still live in the home of your dreams ‚Äî because success with purpose changes the world.

name: Christos Alexakos
title: Dr., Senior Software Engineer, Co-Founder InSyBio Ltd., Assistant Researcher at ISI/ATHENA RC
about:
Christos Alexakos was born in Athens, Greece, in 1979. He the Dipl. Eng. degree in Computer Engineering and Informatics (2003), the MSc in Computer Science and Engineering (2006) and the Ph. D. (2015) from the Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics of the University of Patras, Greece. He is now researcher at the Pattern Recognition Laboratory of the Department of Computer Engineering and Informatics, University of Patras. He is also collaborating as a research engineer at the Industrial Systems Institute and Computer Technology Institute. Furthermore, he was adjunct lecturer, from 2005 to 2012, in the Department of Applied Informatics at Management and Economy, Technical Educational Institute of Messologhi. 
His research is related with Semantic Web, Computational and Artificial Intelligence and Intelligent Agents applications in the fields of enterprise and industrial integration, cloud computing, medical imaging and data, e-learning, digital culture and information retrieval in the WWW. He has published more than 25 articles in international scientific journals and conference proceedings, having more than 170 citations. 
He has 12-year experience in development of software applications, both web-based and standalone including databases applications, GIS and service-oriented applications. He worked as software engineer at 15 research and development projects funded from national and European programs. He is the Technical Manager of Pattern Recognition Laboratory and, in the last 5 years, he was project manager in four development projects that carried out by the laboratory. Since September 2013, he is member of the Website Editorial Board of the American Association of Physicists in Medicine (AAPM).
At October 2013, he founded with his colleagues InSyBio Ltd. InSyBio provides a cloud-driven Software as a Service software suite ‚Äì called InSyBio Suite ‚Äì which assists biology researchers in extracting valuable biological knowledge from experimental data.

His work and publications are in computational intelligence and include autonomous mobile robot navigation, spatial relations, linguistic spatial cognition, programming by demonstration, fuzzy logic and evolutionary computation.

Since 2012, Dr. Chronis is CEO of Foresite Healthcare and one of the company founders. He has led the transfer, development and commercialization of technology to improve quality of life by issuing early illness alerts from research to industry.

name: Byron Auguste
title: CEO & Co-founder at Opportunity@Work | Forbes Future of Work 50
location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
about:
In my two childhood "hometowns" of Detroit, Michigan, and Phoenix, Arizona, I have many family members and friends who‚Äôve found themselves stuck‚Äîneither able to contribute their full talent, nor to be rewarded for them.  As an economist, I see such a waste of talent as a classic market failure.

That‚Äôs why, in 2015, following my service in the White House as Deputy Assistant to the President for Economic Policy and Deputy Director of the National Economic Council, I was inspired to launch Opportunity@Work. 

Our work rises above politics. I have yet to meet a mayor or governor (of either party) who doesn‚Äôt want to bring more good jobs to her or his communities. And in every region of the country, I hear the same thing from business (‚Äúwe can‚Äôt find the skills we need‚Äù) and from hard working people struggling to break into better paying jobs (‚ÄúI know what I can do, but no one will give me a chance‚Äù).  

Re-wiring the U.S labor market to end this damaging market failure is my mission today, and every day, as the Opportunity@Work team, our outstanding partners, and I work to rewire the U.S. labor market so that all individuals Skilled Through Alternative Routes (STARs) can work, learn, and earn to their full potential.
 
In the next decade, Opportunity@Work aims to enable at least 1 million working adults in America to translate their learning into earning ‚Äì generating a $20 billion boost in annual earnings.

Join us‚Äîas we make this vision a reality.

Brian Pallas is CEO and Founder of Opportunity Network, the invitation-only platform that enables highly-screened CEOs and decision-makers to connect on business deals above $2.5Mn.

Before Opportunity Network, Brian worked at the Boston Consulting Group (‚ÄúBCG‚Äù), a global top management consulting firm. He worked in Private Equity for three different funds and managed the sales process of two companies as an Investment Banking. 

Brian started his career as a scriptwriter for a prime-time Italian TV show, Zelig, with an audience of over 3 million viewers. 

In 2014, Brian earned his MBA from Columbia Business School. He also holds a B.S. in Show Business Management and an M.S. in Economics that he achieved graduating cum laude from Universit√† Cattolica del Sacro Cuore in Milan. 

In 2014 Brian has been nominated in 2014 for the Wired Audi Innovation Award by Wired Italy as one of the most promising Under 35. In 2016, at the age of 28, he has been selected as a judge by Forbes to identify the best 30 Under 30 for the first European edition of the ranking. 

Brian is also part of the Expert Network of the World Economic Forum.

name: Ted Green
title: Executive Chairman/Consultant at various companies in media/entertainment
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Ted Green‚Äôs 35+ years in the media industry covers the gamut of operational, financial, and investment experience. Ted is currently the Executive Chairman of several media companies. He was recently the Executive Chairman/Founder of International Literary Properties which acquires all or partial rights to books and book-based intellectual properties for exploitation across multiple channels. 

Mr. Green also serves several other companies on the Board, including as the Executive Chairman of Meelo Logic, an award-winning causal AI technology that assesses human intent. He continues to invest in and advise media companies. 

Prior to 2014, He was the CEO of RLJ Entertainment (NASDAQ:RLJE), a premier distributor of entertainment content and programming in North America, the United Kingdom, and Australia, with over 5,200 exclusive titles. As the Chairman and CEO of Image Entertainment, Mr. Green had acquired the company with a private equity fund in 2010.  In 2012, Ted increased the company‚Äôs valuation by 2.5X by merging Image Entertainment with Acorn Media and selling the merged entity to RLJ Entertainment. 

Mr. Green founded and led TM Media and Entertainment Inc., one of the few successful special purpose acquisition corporations (SPACs), during the 2007-2009 period.  

In 2003 Mr. Green led the initial $60 million acquisition of Anchor Bay Entertainment by IDT Entertainment, Inc., a subsidiary of IDT Corporation (NYSE:IDT), and was thereafter the CEO and was an equity holder until 2006.  Anchor Bay Entertainment is a leader in production, marketing, and distribution of various media.  In the fall of 2006, IDT Entertainment (including Anchor Bay) was sold to Starz Entertainment.

In 2001 Mr. Green established Greenlight Consulting Inc., a project-based consulting practice focused on the media and entertainment industry.  Greenlight‚Äôs clients, included Sony Music and Vivendi-Universal as well as regional media organizations. 

Mr. Green was the Founder/President from 1993 to 2000 of Sony Wonder, the division of Sony Music Entertainment responsible for the production and distribution of media geared toward youthful audiences, and also for all home video distribution. He led revenue growth from zero to over $200 million worldwide.

Prior to Sony Wonder, Mr. Green was the Head of Business Affairs and Music Publishing with Polygram Records, senior executive at CBS Records, and a principal of a music label that was co-owned with Warner Music Group.

about:
Dr. Earl Crane is a managing director at CISOWise LLC. He has over 20 years of experience in cybersecurity risk management, policy, and governance, working with public and private sector organizations across various industries. He holds a Ph.D. in engineering management and information security from George Washington University, and several professional certifications, including CISM, CISSP, and CGEIT.

As a cybersecurity executive and trusted advisor, he provides insights, solutions, and support for complex and emerging challenges, such as risk executive-as-a-service, board-level expertise, FedRAMP cloud security authorization, and cybersecurity product and platform development. He is also a co-founder of Emergynt, a digital risk management platform based on his Ph.D. research, and a contributing author and speaker on cybersecurity topics. He is passionate about advancing the field of cybersecurity and empowering organizations to achieve their goals.

name: Newell Crane
title: Founder of Ethos Care, a virtual Behavioral Health Clinic providing Therapy, Medical Management and Clinical Assessment to Medical Organizations and their patients from New York to Hawaii.
about:
Dr. Crane brings 50 years of experience in the medical, engineering and financial services fields.  In 1969, Dr. Crane began his career with Searle Pharmaceuticals based in Beverly Hills, California.  Over the next 14 years with Searle, Dr. Crane held regional and corporate positions in hospital management, medical training, drug utilization and product analysis.    In 1984 Dr. Crane founded The Cold Jet Company (www.coldjet.com) which is today the world leader in dry ice blasting and dry ice production technology and develops superior dry ice blast cleaning systems to meet every unique cleaning application.  
Also in 1984 Dr. Crane founded the Del Crane Medical Corporation, a company providing billing services and medical supplies to patients in nursing homes.  Del Crane has provided product, billing services and clinical software to over 1,000 nursing homes in the United States until being sold to a major pharmaceutical company in 2001. 

In 2012 Mr. Crane launch Emergent Network Defense (www.emergynt.com) with a new and unique product for the cybersecurity field.

In 2016 Mr. Crane launched Lee Side Wellness - a Cincinnati based psychiatric company.

In 2018 Mr. Crane launched Ethos Care - a national tele-psychiatric and psychological provider network covering states from New York to Hawaii.

Mr. Crane earned an Associated of Arts degree from the Los Angeles Pierce College in 1967, a Bachelor of Science in Biology from the Pepperdine University in 1975, a Masters of Business Administration from Pepperdine University in 1977 and a PhD in Business/Pharmacy in 1982

name: Peter Voss
title: On a mission to bring human-level AI to the world | CEO & Chief Scientist @Aigo.ai
about:
Innovator, Serial Entrepreneur, CEO, Engineer, Scientist.  

My life‚Äôs mission is to bring human-level AI to the world to optimize human flourishing.   

This, the Holy grail of AI, will significantly lower the costs for many products and services; providing PhD-level AI researchers to help us solve problems like disease, energy, and pollution; and help individuals via expert personal assistants that will enhance productivity, problem-solving ability, and their overall well-being.  

I‚Äôve been dedicated to this mission for more than 20 years. I am now leading a new major initiative to leverage our deep experience and standard-setting commercial Aigo technology to rapidly close the gap to wide-ranging human-level capabilities.  

I can‚Äôt think of anything more exciting, or that will have a greater positive impact on humanity.  

Join us in writing the next chapter in the story of human progress. We are actively looking for staff, advisors, collaborators, and investors to accelerate progress.  

Our Technology: The proven path we have taken is‚ÄØvery different‚ÄØfrom the current ‚ÄòBig Data‚Äô statistical or generative AI methods currently favored. Our approach implements an Integrated Cognitive Architecture based on a deep understanding of the requirements of human intelligence. It does not suffer the inherent limitations of Big Data methods.   

Our current commercial product based on this technology is called ‚ÄòAigo ‚Äì Chatbot with a Brain‚Äô.‚ÄØOver the past two years we deployed this at enterprise call centers and now have over a‚ÄØmillion customers with‚ÄØmillion dollars in ARR by‚ÄØproviding‚ÄØhighly successful‚ÄØhyper-personalized service to millions of end users. With this we have set a new standard in automation quality and effectiveness.  

My Journey: Started in electronics engineering, launched my first company, then fell in love with software. First major success was developing a comprehensive ERP package and taking that company from Zero to 400-person IPO in seven years.   

Motivated by overcoming the fragile nature of software, I embarked on a 5-year research stint; to deeply understand the nature of intelligence ‚Äì psychometrics, developmental psychology, epistemology, animal intelligence, and what had been tried and discovered in AI. This research culminated in a new AI theory and the creation of our core AGI technology.  

In 2002 three of us coined the term AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) and published a book. Since then, I have been steadily developing, commercializing,‚ÄØand improving the core technology that will lead us to human-level AI.

name: Yohan Baillot
title: ARCortex CEO | 30+ Years Augmented Reality Veteran | Prototyping AI + AR future
location: Marina del Rey, California, United States
about:
AR Pioneer | CEO of ARCortex | AR/VR Innovator | AI & Geospatial Tech | Defense, Enterprise & First Responders

I am a visionary leader and hands-on developer with over 30 years of experience in Augmented Reality (AR), AI, and geospatial technologies, pioneering solutions that have shaped the industry. I have a MS in EE with minor in Robotics and a MS in CS with minor on Simulation and Training which initiated my focus on AR. From early AR military systems for the U.S. Navy & Army (1999) to cutting-edge AR platforms for defense, first responders, and enterprise applications, my expertise has driven innovation in AR hardware, AI-enhanced visualization, and multi-user immersive systems. 

Currently, as the Founder & CEO of ARCortex, I lead custom AR developments, geospatial AR deployment (WorldEngine), and consulting for enterprises, defense, and public safety organizations. My work bridges computer vision, AI-driven AR, and real-time multi-user collaboration across Hololens, Magic Leap, mobile, and enterprise AR solutions.

# Recent Highlights & Achievements

* Developed WorldEngine, a multi-user AR platform with real-time geospatial tracking for site deployments.

* Lead AR expert in the GenTech vs. Meta patent case, providing critical AR technical analysis.

* Created ERIS, an AR platform for first responders to visualize operations in real-time.

* Architected AR systems for Lenovo, Accenture, Magic Leap Horizons (Defense), and ODG.

* Patent Holder & AR Research Contributor ‚Äì 6+ AR patents, 20+ research papers.

# Notable Past Innovations

1999 ‚Äì Developed one of the first AR backpacks for stereo optical displays (U.S. Navy).

2008¬†‚Äì Built the first AR vehicle system for detecting underground bombs (U.S. Army).

2010 ‚Äì Created one of the first visual-inertial tracking systems on iPad (pre-ARKit).

2015 ‚Äì Developed an AR wire-harness assembly system for the F-35 fighter jet.

2016 ‚Äì Prototyped geo-localized SLAM AR (like Pok√©mon GO).

# Looking for Strategic Collaborations

* Defense & First Responders ‚Äì Deploying ERIS for situational awareness & training.

* Enterprise AR Solutions ‚Äì Custom AI-driven AR applications for AEC, Automotive, Energy, and Public Safety.

* Geospatial AR Deployment ‚Äì Scaling WorldEngine for multi-user, real-world AR integration.

Let‚Äôs Connect! Whether you are a program manager, recruiter, business leader, or investor, I am open to discussions on AR/VR innovation, AI-powered solutions, consulting, and partnerships.

Seeking business-minded partners & co-founders to scale ARCortex‚Äôs impact!

name: Mark Skwarek
title: Full-Time Faculty @ NYU's IDM Tandon, Director Mobile AR Lab @ NYU, Head or 3D for IDM NYU Tandon
about:
Mark Skwarek is an artist working to bridge the gap between virtual and physical world with augmented reality. His art explores the translation our everyday digital experience into the physical world using mobile augmented reality.  He organized the augmented reality artist group manifest.AR, the arOCCUPYWALLSTREET movement, and co-organized We AR in MoMA. Skwarek‚Äôs practice is also largely based in art activism with emerging technologies. He has a long record of international augmented reality work, ranging from ‚Äúerasing‚Äù the DMZ battlements between North and South Korea (a piece he did on site), to the virtual elimination of the barricades between Palestine and Israel, at the Gaza Strip. He has created political work and symbols in a variety of locations across the United States, including pieces at Wall St.,  U.S. Mexico Border and the White House to name a few. Skwarek earned his M.F.A. from Rhode Island School of Design's Digital Media Department. He is full time faculty at New York University Polytech, where he teaches 3D Graphics and the Augmented Reality Grad Class. His artwork has been written about by the New York Times, Art in America, Boing Boing, WIRED, the Boston Globe, The Huffington Post, NPR, BBC, Leonardo, and Creative Capital. Skwarek has exhibited in various venues, including: the Institute of Contemporary Art, Boston; ISEA; Dumbo Arts Festival, UCLA Digital Grad Gallery; the CyberArts Festival; the Sunshine International Art Museum, Beijing; and the Krannert Art Museum at the University of Illinois,  FACT in Liverpool England, Siggraph 2013, the 2013 Augmented World Expo, and The Corocran Gallery of Art.

Specialties: Real time 3d graphics, Maya, 3d Max, Photoshop, After Effects, Z Brush, some Blender
